blurb: The key to enjoying spicy foods? It's all in the attitude
description: Contrary to popular belief, you cannot permanently destroy your taste buds. Eating spicy foods can hurt your tongue and make you less able to perceive the spice, but your taste receptors won’t be gone forever— the effects of desensitization only last a few days. Instead, new research shows that genetics and personality play a much bigger role in our spice tolerance than the physical properties of taste receptors on our tongues.
title: Do you feel the burn? The science behind your spice tolerance
